pullrequest.title: Start doc conversion from mercurial to git.

content.raw:
When I run `yt version` after cloning with git and installing, I get this info:

```
yt module located at:
    /home/lindsayad/yt-git

The current version of yt is:

---
Version = 3.4-dev
---
```
which neither tells the changeset/revision number or whether the branch is up to date. Is this something that will be added?
content.html:
When I run yt version after cloning with git and installing, I get this info:

yt module located at:
    /home/lindsayad/yt-git

The current version of yt is:

---
Version = 3.4-dev
---

which neither tells the changeset/revision number or whether the branch is up to date. Is this something that will be added?

pullrequest.title: Start doc conversion from mercurial to git.

content.raw: I'm looking at the `Doing a Bugfix Release` documentation. I know that I've heard chatter about whether we are going to continue to do bugfix releases...has there been a decision on that? That section has a lot of mercurial in it, and if we are still doing bugfixes, I frankly don't know enough about the backporting to convert the section to git without diving into the backport code.
content.html: I'm looking at the Doing a Bugfix Release documentation. I know that I've heard chatter about whether we are going to continue to do bugfix releases...has there been a decision on that? That section has a lot of mercurial in it, and if we are still doing bugfixes, I frankly don't know enough about the backporting to convert the section to git without diving into the backport code.

pullrequest.title: Start doc conversion from mercurial to git.

content.raw:
I don't think you need to touch any of the documentation outside of `CONTRIBUTING.rst`. See this pull request I just opened earlier today: https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt/pull-requests/2590

Sorry I should have let you know I was going to do that.
content.html:
I don't think you need to touch any of the documentation outside of CONTRIBUTING.rst. See this pull request I just opened earlier today: https://bitbucket.org/yt_analysis/yt/pull-requests/2590

pullrequest.title: Start doc conversion from mercurial to git.

content.raw: And for your specific question I just deleted all the discussion about the backport script. We are definitely still going to do bugfix releases but the way we do it will be very different since the backport script depends on the repository being in mercurial on bitbucket. I will figure that out when we get to the point of needing to do bugfix releases when we're hosted on git.
content.html: And for your specific question I just deleted all the discussion about the backport script. We are definitely still going to do bugfix releases but the way we do it will be very different since the backport script depends on the repository being in mercurial on bitbucket. I will figure that out when we get to the point of needing to do bugfix releases when we're hosted on git.

pullrequest.title: Start doc conversion from mercurial to git.

content.raw:
Yup, one of us will need to clear conflicts. Whichever doesn't get merged first :)

If you revert all the files besides `CONTRIBUTING.rst` here that would also work. Something like:

```
$ hg revert -r 68f97dface72 doc/source/faq/index.rst doc/source/help/index.rst doc/source/installing.rst doc/source/quickstart/index.rst doc/source/visualizing/unstructured_mesh_rendering.rst
$ hg commit -m "reverting changes to files besides CONTRIBUTING"
```
content.html:
Yup, one of us will need to clear conflicts. Whichever doesn't get merged first :)

If you revert all the files besides CONTRIBUTING.rst here that would also work. Something like:

$ hg revert -r 68f97dface72 doc/source/faq/index.rst doc/source/help/index.rst doc/source/installing.rst doc/source/quickstart/index.rst doc/source/visualizing/unstructured_mesh_rendering.rst
$ hg commit -m "reverting changes to files besides CONTRIBUTING"
